dt: {bc}a black or dark viscous substance obtained as a residue in the distillation of organic materials and especially tars
{bc}resin obtained from various conifers and often used medicinally
{bc}any of various artificial mixtures resembling resinous or bituminous {a_link|pitches}

et: Middle English {it}pich{/it}, from Old English {it}pic{/it}, from Latin {it}pic-, pix{/it}; akin to Greek {it}pissa{/it} pitch, Old Church Slavonic {it}pĭcĭlŭ{/it}
shortdef: a black or dark viscous substance obtained as a residue in the distillation of organic materials and especially tars
resin obtained from various conifers and often used medicinally

dt: {bc}to cover, smear, or treat with or as if with pitch

shortdef: to cover, smear, or treat with or as if with pitch

dt: {bc}to erect and fix firmly in place
{bc}to throw usually with a particular objective or toward a particular point
{bc}to toss (something, such as coins) so as to fall at or near a mark
{bc}to put aside or discard by or as if by throwing
{bc}to present or advertise especially in a high-pressure way {bc}{sx|plug||}, {sx|promote||}
{bc}to attempt to persuade especially with a sales pitch
{bc}to present (a movie or program idea) for consideration (as by a TV producer)
{bc}to cause to be at a particular level or of a particular quality

dt.t: a test {wi}pitched{/wi} at a 5th-grade reading level

dt: {bc}to set in a particular musical key
{bc}to cause to be set at a particular angle {bc}{sx|slope||}
{bc}to hit (a golf ball) in a high arc with backspin so that it rolls very little after striking the green
{bc}to have the bow alternately plunge precipitately and rise abruptly

sls: of an aircraft, missile, or spacecraft
dt: {bc}to turn about a lateral axis so that the forward end rises or falls in relation to the after end
{bc}to hit upon or happen upon something
{bc}to throw a ball to a batter

pt: {sc}throw{/sc} {sc}cast{/sc} {sc}toss{/sc} {sc}fling{/sc} {sc}hurl{/sc} {sc}pitch{/sc} {sc}sling{/sc} mean to cause to move swiftly through space by a propulsive movement or a propelling force. {sc}throw{/sc} is general and interchangeable with the other terms but may specifically imply a distinctive motion with bent arm.

pt.t: can {it}throw{/it} a fastball and a curve

pt: {sc}cast{/sc} usually implies lightness in the thing thrown and sometimes a scattering.
{sc}toss{/sc} suggests a light or careless or aimless throwing and may imply an upward motion.

pt.t: {it}flung{/it} the ring back in his face

pt: {sc}hurl{/sc} implies power as in throwing a massive weight.
{sc}pitch{/sc} suggests throwing carefully at a target.
{sc}sling{/sc} stresses either the use of whirling momentum in throwing or directness of aim.

et: Middle English {it}pichen{/it} to thrust, drive, fix firmly, probably from Old English {it}*piccan{/it}, from Vulgar Latin {it}*piccare{/it} {ma}{mat|pike|}{/ma}
shortdef: to erect and fix firmly in place
to throw usually with a particular objective or toward a particular point : such as
to throw (a baseball) to a batter

dt: {bc}the distance between any of various things: such as
{bc}distance between one point on a gear tooth and the corresponding point on the next tooth
{bc}distance from any point on the thread of a screw to the corresponding point on an adjacent thread measured parallel to the axis
{bc}the theoretical distance a propeller would advance longitudinally in one revolution
{bc}the number of teeth or of threads per inch
{bc}a unit of width of type based on the number of times a letter can be set in a linear inch
{bc}the relative level, intensity, or extent of some quality or state
{bc}the property of a sound and especially a musical tone that is determined by the frequency of the waves producing it {bc}highness or lowness of sound
{bc}the difference in the relative vibration frequency of the human voice that contributes to the total meaning of speech
{bc}a definite relative pitch that is a significant phenomenon in speech
{bc}the portion of a route (as in mountain climbing or caving) between belay points
{bc}an outdoor site (as for camping or doing business)
{bc}an all-fours game in which the first card led is a trump
{bc}the delivery of a baseball by a {a_link|pitcher} to a batter

art.capt: pitch 4b(1): two systems of staff notation of pitch

shortdef: slope; also : degree of slope : rake
the distance between any of various things: such as
distance between one point on a gear tooth and the corresponding point on the next tooth
to contribute to a common endeavor

dt: {bc}sensitive to or having exactly the right tone or style

dt.t: The political newcomer launched and led a {wi}pitch-perfect{/wi} race over the summer.

shortdef: sensitive to or having exactly the right tone or style

dt: {bc}any of several pines that yield pitch
{bc}a 3-leaved pine ({it}Pinus rigida{/it}) of eastern North America

shortdef: any of several pines that yield pitch; especially : a 3-leaved pine (Pinus rigida) of eastern North America
the wood of a pitch pine

dt: {bc}a small reed pipe or flue pipe producing one or more tones to establish the pitch in singing or in tuning an instrument

shortdef: a small reed pipe or flue pipe producing one or more tones to establish the pitch in singing or in tuning an instrument
